attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Railway from increasing their 2017 ticket fares
attributes.background:
Southeaster railway continues to increase annual season ticket fares each year but never improve upon the service they offer. It was voted one of the worst ways to commute to London in 2016. 
Train fares have been reported to increase twice as fast as salaries in the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
We all pay thousands of pounds a year to travel into London or elsewhere via Southeastern railway and each year it gets more expensive and the service gets worse and worse with signalling problems, delayed trains, cancelled trains etc. 
It needs to stop so that everyone pays a FAIR amount for the poor service we are getting. I'm sure most would agree that we would be happy to pay the amount we are paying if the trains ran on time and without delays and if we all got a seat on our long commutes.

attributes.action: Remove the luxury tax on feminine hygiene products once and for all time!
attributes.background: In the UK, flapjacks and crocodile meat are at a 0% VAT rate, yet an essential item for all women is classed under the 'luxury' tax bracket. The so called 'tampon tax' is a ridiculous way of financially victimising women. We the people (signed below) demand an end to this deliberate extortion.

attributes.action: Restrict Rail Franchise Owners paying excessive dividends when performance fails
attributes.background:
Some Train Operating Companies have fallen far short of their Public Performance Measures (PPM).

Simultaneously Franchise Owners - such as the Go Ahead Group - continue to pay material dividends that offer investors an attractive yield (e.g. 4-5%) which is 10 to 20 times the typical savings rate.
attributes.additional_details:
The PPM of the GoVia Thameslink Group (Southern, GEX and TL) is around 70% in 2016 so far - against the target for of around 86%. One in 3 trains is late.

The service that funds their dividends has failed to meet acceptable standards, and annual fare increases continue to be applied which contribute to that dividend.

This petition seeks to apply legislation that forces Franchise Owners to limit dividend distribution when PPM and other measures fall materially, and serially, short of target.

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase ‘up to’ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinckley C
attributes.background:
Call on Theresa May to scrap Hinkley C

I have no in principle objection to nuclear power. Neither do I wish to comment on cost, no-one on the planet knows whether the strike price will be good bad or indifferent in 10, 20 or 30 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly we do not know if it will work! There is no working version to base a decision on. What if in 8 years we find it doesn't? We will have a serious problem.

Second, EDF will come under huge pressure to make it work and make it work by 2025, what short cuts might they be tempted to perform as a consequence?

Finally, the world political scene is unclear for the next 5 years let alone 30+ years, we simply should not put the energy production for our country in the hands of other countries.

attributes.action: The government is to declassify all plans on TTIP & make plans available online
attributes.background: Such a large trade deal should be available for all the public to read and scrutinise, why is it that we are having to request this information into the public eye. We want this information to be accessible to all people, as we all know the consequences of deals made outside the democratic arena.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transatlantic_Trade_and_Investment_Partnership

attributes.action: Fair and regulated pricing for EV charging points within the UK.
attributes.background: Ecotricity today 7th July 2016 increased the price of EV charging from free to £5 per a 20 minute charge. They apparently consulted EV drivers and consider this to be a fair price. The new pricing makes long distance travel not economically viable with an EV.

attributes.action: Make schools remove climbing frames due to the health and safety of the children
attributes.background: I believe that climbing frames are a risk to the health and safety of children when used in a school playground environment. They are at risk of serious injury should they fall or are pushed by another child.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter had an accident at her local Nursery when playing on the climbing frame, she fell from the top bar and then hit another bar seriously injuring her before she hit the ground.
I feel that children in a school environment are at a higher risk of injury from playing on a climbing frame than if they were playing on one in a park with their parents there to supervise.

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Create an offence of making knowingly or recklessly false claims in elections
attributes.background: The EU Referendum on the continuing membership of the EU has highlighted the use of clear untruths and other misleading comments.  Voters have suggested they would have voted differently if they had known the truth.  There should be criminal liability for such activity to prevent it reoccurring.
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign claimed that £350M per week would be released to be spent on the NHS.  This claim was stated to be false by "Leave" within days of the vote.

Individuals who make false statements to the state (for example in relation to benefits) risk being prosecuted, whilst politicians are not censured for false statements to the people.  We believe that a separate offence of knowingly or recklessly making false statements or misleading the public in relation to elections is required.

attributes.action: Debate within 100 days the Government's costed plan for the UK to leave the EU
attributes.background: Good governance requires such a momentous change of national direction to be underpinned by a properly formulated plan with specific objectives, milestones for the change process and timescales for final delivery, detailed costings and an associated risk management plan.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the United Kingdom must be informed of the plan and its detail debated in Parliament within 100 days.

attributes.action: Allow immigrants to vote in UK national elections and referendums.
attributes.background: The scapegoating of immigrants during political campaigns narrows the debate, hides the true reasons for economic problems, and distorts the result. If immigrants were granted the vote, as they are in local elections, they would not be targeted in this way.
attributes.additional_details: During the 18 September 2014 referendum on Scottish independence, all EU and Commonwealth citizens resident in Scotland aged 16 or over could vote. During the 23rd June 2016 referendum on the UK's membership of the EU, immigrants from the EU were not allowed to vote, though commonwealth citizens were. The campaign focussed unduly on the issue of immigration to the detriment of other important issues.

attributes.action: Allow retirement with State Pension if people worked 40 years and contributed.
attributes.background: Loads of people have worked all of their lives and never claimed benefits, we now see retirement ages get further away. If they have worked all of their lives and paid taxes and NI  for 40 years  they should be allowed to retire with state pension irrespective of age..

attributes.action: Don't ban menthol cigarettes
attributes.background:
Plain packaging is coming into force and there is a proposal to ban menthol cigarettes. 


Menthol cigarettes makes up a large percentage of smokers and has existed for almost a hundred years.


Ban other flavours but make an exception for menthols like the US.
attributes.additional_details:
I thought all cigarettes were the same, so why treat some cigarettes different to others?


- Ban flavours, keep the menthol


- Halt any new anti-tobbaco law for at least 10 years 


- Don't allow cigarette prices to reach £15 by 2020

attributes.action: more research doing into duchenne muscular dystrophy and help find a cure please
attributes.background: Would like more research doing into duchenne muscular dystrophy to help find a cure for all the little kids that have been found to have it myself I have a nearly 3 year old that's got duchenne muscular dystrophy and have found out our other son might also have duchenne muscular dystrophy

attributes.action: Require NHS Trusts to publish amounts paid for early severance etc.
attributes.background: At a time when it is so important that expenditure in the NHS is not only well controlled and appropriately targeted, NHS Trusts should be required to publicly account for such payments.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence recently published by the Eastern Daily Press shows that £6m  was spent in two years by East of England Ambulance Service.  Another Ambulance Service appears to have expended significant amounts but does not quantify that and other NHS trusts have failed to reveal this information.  At a time when it is so important that expenditure in the NHS is not only well controlled and appropriately targeted, NHS Trusts should be required to publicly account for such payments.

attributes.action: Allow regions of England  to hold a referendum on regional  assemblies
attributes.background: the recent revelations of the panama papers highlights the Westminster bubble i feel power should devolved into the hands of the people, it would give  a greater voice to regions such as the north and the midlands who are not being represented by a London focused Westminster
attributes.additional_details: i am aware john Prescott attempted something similarly in the past but the direct democracy of regional assembly remains the way forward as these assemblies would be better placed to dealing with local issues and would more accountable to the voters giving the proximity to them it would also ease the load on central government the is already support for regional assembles in England http://www.wessexregionalists.info/ and http://www.thenortheastparty.org.uk/

attributes.action: Build a gas-powered station at Hinckley Point instead of a nuclear station.
attributes.background: The South West needs a new power station to avoid blackouts in the next decade. It is increasingly clear that a nuclear station cannot be completed in less than 20 years. The enormous amount of money saved can be spent developing tidal power in the Severn Estuary. It is time to think again.
attributes.additional_details: We need low carbon base-load power. Nuclear would, in theory, provide this. However, tidal power could provide a better, safer solution. The sister nuclear stations at Olkiluoto 3 in Finland and Flamanville in France are billions of Euros over budget and years behind schedule. There is no reason to think Hinckley will be completed on time and to budget. EDF know this, both governments know it and the Chinese require an indemnity from us because they know it. We can build an LNG dock for the gas.

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Give drink drivers an instant 4 week jail sentence if convicted to deter them.
attributes.background: In 2014 stats show that some 220 people were killed in crashes in which a driver was over the legal limit, 880 were seriously injured. Nearly 1 in 6 of all deaths on the road involve drivers who are over the legal alcohol limit. This is still too high and people still think it's OK to drink-drive.
attributes.additional_details: A total of 613,090 people were charged with drink driving during this period. 2004 - 2014. Statistics show that 595,093 (97%) of defendants charged were subsequently convicted while 17,997 (97%) were not convicted. Taken from drink driving.org

attributes.action: Require universities to provide night-time safety to stop sexual harassment
attributes.background: Improve safety around the University at night for women and men when traveling and walking around the site.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost £4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: Make June 23 a bank holiday to celebrate UK Independence Day.
attributes.background: To celebrate the EU referendum historic result where the people of the UK voted to regain independence from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The people have spoken and voted for a self Governing UK. This wonderful example of democratic success deserves to be remembered forever. A bank holiday would enable the people to celebrate the occasion.

attributes.action: Strengthen Laws against Negligent Private Surgeons & Healthcare Providers
attributes.background:
Private healthcare patients are commonly led to believe that the care they are paying for will meet the highest standards. 
In cases where patients receive wrongful or negligent treatment  private healthcare patients have less access to adequate redress and compensation than NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
At present legislation is so insufficient that one private healthcare company actually stated in a legal defence document that they were ‘under no obligation to provide competent surgeons to perform surgery at the hospital’ and had ‘no duty to protect patients from harm, and risk of injury’.

We ask Secretary of State for Health, Jeremy Hunt  to close the legal loophole which allows for private healthcare patients to be left without protection or redress when things go wrong.

attributes.action: Increase government funding on organisations aiding terminal illness patients
attributes.background: Hospices and other organisations dedicate de to aiding those suffering from terminal illnesses such as dementia or cancer have been undervalued, either by a lack of pay or by an equal lack of resources, together we can increase welfare funding for such organisations such as these to beneficiaries.
attributes.additional_details: Organisations that enlist the aid of care professionals often being undervalued is often being seen in our headlines, our media is very biased in the covering of care workers and thus fewer people are as inclined to openly support the patients, their familles and carers through more comprehensive grief counselling and resources to truly allow these people a chance to live happily and find contentement despite any terminal illnesses.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: Repeal tail docking ban for KC working breeds at the very least The Dobermann
attributes.background: In 2007 the government banned the docking of tails, but allowed some working breeds to continue to be docked, 9yrs down the line and the amount of damaged tails is causing immeasurable suffering Please think carefully and help to end the suffering of these dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence will be updated daily here from July 26th 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1753160231634236/
Repeal the ban or at the very least allow all breeds classified as Working Group dogs have their tails docked by a vet. Older dogs having tails amputated is not acceptable.The Doberman has been 
traditionally docked from its creation, now with tails we have 
varying degrees of length carriage and thickness this is causing unnecessary suffering. Allow docking by a vet within 3 days of birth.

attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: Bring back levels for assessment and stop labelling our children as failures.
attributes.background: Children who don't meet the expected standard for their year group are being assessed as emerging and not 'Year _ ready'. Essentially we are telling them they have failed! Children need encouragement not labelling in this way. Levels mean that progress can easily be seen year on year.
attributes.additional_details: A whole generation of our children risk being labelled failures by the system that replaced levels. Previously a child and their parents would easily see progress during a school year by looking at their levels. Currently they are labelled as 'emerging', 'expected' or 'exceeding' and a child who is emerging is then described as not being ready for the next year group that they move in to. If our children are to achieve their true potential, we need to stop labelling them as failures!

attributes.action: Government to condemn the USA police forces for killing innocent Black citizens
attributes.background: Statistics show that on average around 30 African American citizens in America are killed by law enforcement officers each month.  This is unacceptable in a civilized society.  The UK is America's closest alley and so should be able to speak up and ask that America takes measures to stop this issue.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_in_the_United_States

attributes.action: Make it an offence to park a motor vehicle on a public footpath.
attributes.background: Vehicles obstructing the public footpath, are breaking the law, to enable a vehicle to park in such a way, the vehicle has driven to its position, driving on the footpath is illegal. Pedestrians on many occasions have to walk into traffic to pass these vehicles obstructing the footpath.
attributes.additional_details: Section 34(1) of the Road Traffic Act 1988 (RTA 1988) provides that anyone driving a mechanically propelled vehicle, for example a motor car, on a road that is a footpath, bridleway or restricted byway is guilty of an offence unless it can be shown that there is a private right in place for people to use the accessway to gain vehicular access to their property. The burden of proving that there is such a vehicular right of way in place rests with the defendant.

attributes.action: Disability football should get more recognition
attributes.background: I Strongly Believe That Disability Football Should be Recognized more as a normal thing in society and that our government should support it more by supplying more funding and more publicity,
attributes.additional_details: Football can play a key role in any persons development let alone a disabled persons development, It can help them get Independence, socialize more and develop fine motor skills. Most football clubs run Disability football and it should get recognize more just like main stream football.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: All NHS employers to pay staff at least the living wage.
attributes.background: Some of the lowest paid NHS staff are working below the living wage. Please sign and support this petition

attributes.action: Teach anti-racist/bullying and self esteem building classes in schools
attributes.background: In this day and age we have come across more prejudice, xenophobia, racism and bullying.  This has escalated due to recent events.  In order for the future generation of children the most important thing a child should learn is respect for self and others.
attributes.additional_details: We must teach that bullying is wrong, tolerance for others is important for the process of peace. The current situation as we have discovered from recent events from voting out, has left our country in a state of racism, xenophobia and bullying.  We must act quickly to instigate peace and so that the new generation of Brits are tolerance, happier and peaceful people.  We have a country of British people of all races, religions, sexes and we must learn to live in peace and respectful of each other.  Bullying has been a major factor in all schools and the only way to diminish it is to build respect for self and others through classes and build their self esteem. This will have a positive impact for the future generation of British people no matter what race they are from.

attributes.action: Give all British expats and EU citizens living long-term in UK vote on EU.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Act of 2015 disqualified many people who vote in local or general elections from voting on EU membership. We ask for a reform of the Act, to give franchise on EU membership to all British expats, and to EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years.
attributes.additional_details:
Commonwealth citizens residing in the UK could vote on EU membership on 23rd June 2016, whilst expats living abroad for more than fifteen years, and EU citizens living in Britain, could not. This disfavours individuals who have fully invested in the opportunities granted by Britain’s long-term membership of the EU. We believe the Act goes against EU rights of free movement and the constitutional, common law of Britain.
We ask for another Act to be passed to allow a new Referendum in which all expats, and EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years, may vote. If we are to leave or remain in the EU, it must be a lawful decision, reflecting the wishes of our entire society.

attributes.action: Call a referendum so London can decide to be part of the UK or remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
London, as defined by all postal codes with a LONDON prefix, voted by overwhelming majority in the recent European referendum to remain part of the EU.  

We, the undersigned, believe that London should be allowed to decide its own future as separate from the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
London and its population has stronger ties to Europe than it does to England.  e.g. our dependence on financial services.

London voted by a similar margin in favour of Remain as Scotland.  By the same right that Scotland has to now decide its future, so does London. 

Our population is significantly more European and culturally diverse than the rest of the UK.

London gives more to the UK in tax revenue than the UK gives to London.  We would be stronger if financially independent.

attributes.action: Create a memorial or name a room within the Palace of Westminster after Jo Cox
attributes.background: Jo Cox MP was a Member of Parliament who dedicated the past year to her community and often fought for more things for Young people. In the memory of her life I propose that the Palace of Westminster name an area, room or dedicate a memorial to her life in her memory.

attributes.action: That Non Stun slaughter be debated in Parliament.
attributes.background: I have researched what the doctrinal basis for Shechita is. We are in the new millennium and Shechita slaughter is no longer the most humane way to kill. When the Holy Prophet was alive, stunning methods used today did not exist.
attributes.additional_details:
The Food Research Institute state that killing an animal before it is bled out by high voltage electrical stunning does not affect the amount of blood lost from the carcass.  I have spoken to Jewish people on this issue they say they can see no reason why animals cannot be stunned first.
A witness to Shechita slaughter described a knife was drawn 17 times across a bullocks throat. A shock on his face as he tried to move away.

attributes.action: Fully fund University Education for priority careers e.g. Health,Sciences Eng...
attributes.background: We desperately need Doctors, Scientists, Engineers, yet every year we fail to train in sufficient numbers whilst pumping out graduates in law, media, politics, travel and more exotic topics which rarely lead to careers where our society needs them most.
attributes.additional_details:
We must encourage more students entering higher education to consider where society needs them most by offering to fully fund their academic fees on the basis that they first qualify and then agree to work in their chosen field here in the UK for a minimum of 10 years after qualifying or the fee's - based on a sliding scale will be recoverable.
These publicly funded places should be offered entirely to satisfy the needs of our society and no other consideration should be evaluated or allowed.

attributes.action: Stop charging extortionate Child Visa fees and NHS Surcharges
attributes.background: Dependent children of Non-EU immigrants are charged same visa fees and NHS levy as adults. It is appalling that child visa fee in a temporary visa category is as much as £1790+ £200 NHS levy/year. They are not entitled to any kind of state benefits in the UK and shouldn’t be charged hefty visa fees
attributes.additional_details: If a Non-EU family of 4, 2 adults and 2 toddlers, needs to extend their stay in UK for 2 years, they would pay £7160 Visa + Biometric fees and £1600 NHS levy. Visa fee is irrespective of how short is their stay, means if an immigrant’s spouse and a child granted 6 months visa they would still pay £3580 in visa fees only. Fair fees are part of business ethics and Governments are also expected to conduct their business ethically. Be ethical and considerate and abolish child visa fees and NHS Levy

attributes.action: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens.
attributes.background: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens. This will allow more students to have the opportunity to get a degree and be able to apply for the best jobs.

attributes.action: All NHS ambulance trusts to use a life saving database which is free to use
attributes.background: The AUXILIUM SYSTEM was invented and funded after two local girls were killed on the way to and from school. The database was developed over several years from discussion with many Doctors Paramedics, Ambulance Hub Personnel etc. The database will be free for the NHS to use now and forever.
attributes.additional_details: If a person wearing an AUXILIUM number is found unconscious the number can be read to an ambulance call centre, then person’s information is relayed to paramedics regarding the patient before the paramedics arrive on the scene. .The AUXILIUM number costs only £1 per year per person, and you can change as many times as you wish .AUXILIUM has offered around 1,000,000 lifesaving numbers to charities and is now able to offer all schools in the UK a free number for all their pupils around 8 million.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Government to Stop using private enterprise caterer and return military cooks
attributes.background: At present the services use private enterprise caterer such as Sodexo Catering Services. and the standard of food provided is not to a suitable standards.  and as the cost is increasing this situation should be rectified
attributes.additional_details: As members of the services are on a compulsory pay to dine scheme and it would appear their complaints are ignored. the government must take action.  The services have to have catering staff for service in areas of hostility these should also be in charge af army cook houses

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Cross party review of Hinkley Point C costs, design risks and EDF's commitment.
attributes.background:
Hinkley Point C go-ahead is imminent.
Review needed of:
- construction costs,
- design risks (design known to be a problem / unproven),
- EDF's commitment to UK project given their own nuclear fleet needs refurbishment,
- agreed strike-price and top up by customers now power prices have fallen
attributes.additional_details:
http://stophinkley.org/StopPress.htm
https://secure.greenpeace.org.uk/page/s/osborne-dont-waste-billions-nuclear?source=em&subsource=20160307egem01&utm_source=gpeace&utm_medium=em&utm_campaign=20160307egem01

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act
